snippet: The Obama administration, seeking to cut off oil to the government of President Bashar al-Assad, imposed penalties on five people and six companies.
abstract: Obama administration, seeking to cut off flow of oil to government of Pres Bashar al-Assad, imposes penalties on five people and six companies it says are defying American sanctions and helping Syria’s government attack its own citizens.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration, seeking to cut off oil to the government of President Bashar al-Assad, imposed penalties on five people and six companies.

headline.main: U.S. Penalizes Companies for Providing Fuel to Syrian Forces
headline.print_headline: U.S. Penalizes Companies for Providing Fuel to Syrian Forces
